assetProfile.longBusinessSummary: ALCONIX Corporation imports, exports, and sells non-ferrous metal products in Japan and internationally. The company is involved in the import, export, processing, and intermediate trading of rare metals and materials, such as tungsten, tantalum, titanium, molybdenum, rare earth and other rare metals, tin, nickel, and other LME metals, as well as scrapping of rare and noble metals. It also offers copper tubes and tanks for water supply/drains, heat exchangers, refrigerant, heating oil, and gas materials and equipment; aluminum coils and other aluminum products; plastic tubes; freon gas and other industrial gases; electronic materials for semiconductors; copper and copper-base alloy products; aluminum and office finished products; copper bands and plates; aluminum and copper scraps; and stainless steel and plastic products. In addition, the company manufactures and sells copper anodes and cathodes, copper sulfate, oxygen-free copper wire, bus bars and copper chloride/nickel anodes, nickel sulfate and acetate, nickel bromide, nickel chloride/potassium cyanide, boric acid and sulfamate, and sulfamic acid compounds; welding materials; tools and devices for non-destructive inspection; printing and marking equipment; and carbon and powder metallurgy products, and electrical components and materials. Further, it provides semiconductor packaging machines; prototype parts for automobiles; industrial robots, and machining tools and parts; electromagnetic valve parts; heater core parts; machined metal parts; housing construction materials; solar power generation equipment; and various types of brackets. The company was formerly known as Nissho Iwai Alconix Corporation and changed its name to ALCONIX Corporation in April 2005. ALCONIX Corporation was founded in 1981 and is headquartered in Tokyo, Japan.
